definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
certificate/proof/to prove/to demonstrate/to confirm/variant of 症[zheng4]

sentences.english: Want to be an assistant judge or notary.
sentences.chinese: 想成为一名助理法官或公证人。

sentences.english: Thus, the seller would become notaries employers.
sentences.chinese: 这样，卖方等于成了公证人的雇主。

sentences.english: Where do the sureties or Notary Public sign?
sentences.chinese: 担保人或公证人需要在哪里签署？

sentences.english: Article 94th notary public can not be made into a case of refusing the certificate.
sentences.chinese: 第九十四条在不能获得公证人情况下作成的拒绝证书。

sentences.english: In the face of the changing modus operandi, notaries are also quite helpless.
sentences.chinese: 面对犯罪手法的变化多端，公证人员们也颇为无奈。

sentences.english: Notaries other elements that should be recorded.
sentences.chinese: 公证人员认为应当记录的其他内容。

sentences.english: The notary looked at the count with astonishment.
sentences.chinese: 那公证人惊异地望着伯爵。

sentences.english: The whole process was supervised by the municipal notaries and policemen.
sentences.chinese: 整个过程在公证人员和警察的监督下进行。

definition: eyewitness (to an incident)/witness (to a legal transaction)

pinyin: hun1 qian2 cai2 chan3 gong1 zheng4

definition: to act as surety for sb/to be sb's guarantor/to stand bail for sb
